result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Leosha Shonmonique Stones.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. State receives counter offer. State requests more time for possible resolution. For reasons stated on the record, court orders matter be placed on trial calendar. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Leosha Shonmonique Stones.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury status hearing. Defense requested status conference date due to recent Covid-19 contact. Court granted defense's request and VACATED jury trial. All ordered conditions of bail remain. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for a final pre-trial. Parties report that case remains to be in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on September 26th, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Case set for final pretrial and Jury Trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Schlax.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 38. Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency Hearing. Defendant does not appear, Court issues a bench warrant. Case recalled. The defendant appears, Court withdraws the bench warrant.  Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Lori Kuehn, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Matter in court for status conference. Defendant does not qualify for public representation. For reasons stated on the record, court orders case be set for Indigency Hearing in Br. 38. Matter is adjourned for cause.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD needs more information to determine the eligibility of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
CORRECTION TO 01.25.2022 ENTRY.  Court ordered $5,000 Signature Bond, NOT cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with DCA; TA
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Leosha Shonmonique Stones in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leosha Shonmonique Stones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  On Court's own motion, Court ordered COUNT 3 DISMISSED; lack of probable cause.  AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
